error: preg_match(): Compilation failed: subpattern name must start with a non-digit at offset
solution: This error is caused by a malformed regular expression your routes.php file. Please don't use subpattern names that start with a number.

error: Uncaught mysqli_sql_exception: Access denied for user
solution: This error is caused by a wrong database username or password in your settings.json file.

There is 2 probable causes.
1: Admin credentials file(account.ini) is not found.
2: account.ini moved into /app/adminAccount.ini in leravel v1.3 update. If adminAccount.ini isn't in app folder it may be the cause.

The default MySQLI connection having trouble connecting to the MySQL server
Check if your MySQL server is on. Or disable the database entirely from settings.json
This error means the language user is trying to use is not indexed in the settings.json file.

error: Trying to access array offset on value of type null
solution:
This may be caused by a bunch of thing but here is some probable causes:
1. There may be an error in settings.json
A lang key you used doesn't exist
